alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Gabriel Mountains; Los Angeles County San Gabriel Valley; Western San Gabriel Mountains and Highway 14 Corridor (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 13 at 1:26PM PDT until March 15 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Most of Los Angeles County except the Antelope Valley. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Heavy rain and excessive runoff may result in dangerous flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Extensive street flooding is likely. There may be mudslides and rockslides, especially in and near steep terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Gabriel Mountains; Los Angeles County San Gabriel Valley; Western San Gabriel Mountains and Highway 14 Corridor
